comments:
From out of nowhere, I get the attached exception in the Error Log when invoking New->Project->Web/Dynamic Web Project or Web/Static Web Project.

How can that happen? I did not do anything special to me installation (I installed from the all-in-one bundle and updated to Eclipse 3.1.2 when it became available via the update manager). How can I fix my current installation?

Did you do anything like install the all-in-one over existing files?  NoClassDefFoundErrors are almost always the result of a corrupted installation.
No, I didn't. I only upgraded to Eclipse 3.1.2 via the Update Manager.
Jeffrey, any thoughts to help Andreas?  My only thought would be just to create a new build from scratch...

Re-installing will not fix the bug that caused this problem.

I'm not primarly searching for user assistance, I'd like to help fix bugs like this. Situations for whose re-installing is the only cure reminds me of a widely used operating system...
Reinstalling was only suggested because a NoClassDefFoundError generally means a mismatch in the versions of the installed code.
In the meantime, I installed Calisto. This cured the problem for me, but I don't know if it fixed the bug.
This should be working in WTP 1.5 RC2.
